Header: Peru incinerates more than 15 tonnes of seized drugs
Content: Authorities in Peru incinerated some 15 tonnes of seized drugs from various anti-narcotics operations across the country. According to authorities, the drugs included cocaine, marijuana and various other chemical substances in different stages of production. The United Nations has reported that Peru competes with Colombia for the title of world’s top coca and cocaine producer.Most of Peru’s coca is grown in a lawless jungle area inhabited by holdout Shining Path rebels, as well as near the tourist region of Cusco.
